context: An alert indicates suspicious remote activity initiated on a machine, which may include actions like initiating interactive sessions, modifying files, passing WMI commands, creating scheduled tasks, and other potentially malicious activities from a remote machine. There are multiple processes observed during this activity such as `get-userprttoken.ps1` executed by powershell script, several `bcdedit` commands altering boot status and recovery settings, and even a curl request to vectorsandarrows.com. This alert occurred on host `vnevado-win11u`.
question: Regarding the observed suspicious activity on `vnevado-win11u`, can you identify the host that had its system recovery settings tampered with?
solution_steps: Suspicious remote activity was initiated which led to the execution of `vssblatemp.exe` on host `vnevado-win11t`.
vssblatemp.exe was likely used to tamper with system recovery settings on host `vnevado-win11t`.
